content: 1. I don't have a send command if I click on a email composition window, either. 2. To send and email, use the command Ctrl+Enter 3. If you don't have a send button, you may have switched off one of the toolbars. In the composition window go to View/Toolbars 4. When you say you did not receive an email, do you mean it didn't arrive at the server? OR did TB not download it? Did TB not even try? What error messages do you get?

creator: frisée

content:
Hamburger (top right)/Account Settings/Server Settings - for each account untick the Server Settings that schedule email retrieval automatically.

You could delete all the servers, too, but if something happens to your other laptop, you would want a back up.
creator: frisée

content: If you mean Blue Mail's MagicSync software, it seems that you need to follow the instructions supplied by the manufacturer. If not, please explain a little more fully what he problem is.

content:
For reference, since I had never heard of "PEC", from Wikipedia: "Certified email (known as Posta elettronica certificata in Italy, or PEC in short) is a special type of email in use in Italy".

I have the same issue for incoming/outgoing S/MIME signed emails.

128.6.0esr (32-Bit) on Windows 10.

content:
Sunday is the first day of the week. The West has corrupted the seven day cycle. The sabbath is the Saturday - always has been - and, as such, is the end of the cycle.

TB will allow to set up whichever display option you prefer.

To change the calendar to show Monday, go to the cog (bottom left), then Calendar and then 'Start the week on' on the right.
creator: frisée
